DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Kitchen Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Range 0 to 5 Unit level
        Off [0]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
    Timer
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 5 Unit level
    Off [DOF]
    Set Speed [SSPD]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 5 Unit level
    Set Direction [SDIR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Forward [0]
            Reverse [1]
    Set Timer [STMR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    On [DON]
    Off [DOF]
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you set the kitchen fan to run at speed level 3 and reverse the direction?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The fan speed ranges from 0 (off) to 5 levels, and direction can be either Forward or Reverse. The accepted commands include Set Speed (SSPD) with a level parameter 0-5 and Set Direction (SDIR) with enum values Forward or Reverse.

To set the fan to speed level 3, I use the Set Speed command with parameter 3. To reverse the direction, I use Set Direction with parameter Reverse.

Result: Send Set Speed (SSPD) with value 3 and Set Direction (SDIR) with value Reverse to configure the kitchen ceiling fan accordingly.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Living Room Smart Thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [0]
        Medium [1]
        High [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [ST]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SM]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            Heat [1]
            Cool [2]
            Auto [3]
    Set Fan Speed [SFS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Low [0]
            Medium [1]
            High [2]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RPT]
    Report Mode [RPM]

USER QUERY:
What's the current temperature and mode of the living room thermostat?

I look at the device properties: Current Temperature ranges from 5.0 to 35.0 °C, and Mode can be Off, Heat, Cool, or Auto. The device supports Query commands and can send Report Temperature and Report Mode commands.

To get the current temperature and mode, I would send the Report Temperature (RPT) and Report Mode (RPM) commands to retrieve the latest values.

Result: Query the thermostat by sending Report Temperature and Report Mode commands to obtain the current temperature and operating mode.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Bedroom Smart Window Shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
        Fully Closed [0]
        Fully Open [100]
    Tilt Angle
      Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Status
      Enum
        Stopped [0]
        Moving Up [1]
        Moving Down [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open [OPEN]
    Close [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SPOS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Set Tilt [STILT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range -90 to 90 Unit degrees
    Stop [STOP]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Position [RPOS]
    Report Tilt [RTILT]

USER QUERY:
Please set the bedroom window shade to 75% open and tilt the slats to 30 degrees.

Reviewing the device properties, Position ranges from 0% (fully closed) to 100% (fully open), and Tilt Angle ranges from -90 to 90 degrees. The accepted commands include Set Position (SPOS) with a percentage parameter and Set Tilt (STILT) with a degree parameter.

To fulfill the request, I will send Set Position with 75% to open the shade to that level, and Set Tilt with 30 degrees to adjust the slats accordingly.

Result: Execute Set Position (SPOS) with value 75 and Set Tilt (STILT) with value 30 to adjust the bedroom window shade as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Garage Door Controller
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
        Opening [2]
        Closing [3]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Door Status [RDST]
    Report Lock Status [RLST]

USER QUERY:
Is the garage door currently locked and closed?

The device has two relevant properties: Door Status (Closed, Open, Opening, Closing) and Lock Status (Locked, Unlocked). To determine the current state, I would send Report Door Status and Report Lock Status commands.

By retrieving these reports, I can confirm if the door is both locked and closed.

Result: Send Report Door Status (RDST) and Report Lock Status (RLST) commands to check if the garage door is currently locked and closed.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:

What is the current humidity and temperature in the bathroom?

The device properties include Humidity Level (0-100%) and Temperature (0-50 °C). The device supports Query commands and can send Report Humidity and Report Temperature commands.

To get the current humidity and temperature, I will send Report Humidity (RHUM) and Report Temperature (RTMP) commands.

Result: Query the bathroom humidity sensor by sending Report Humidity and Report Temperature commands to obtain the current readings.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Hallway Motion Detector
  ***Properties***
    Motion Detected
      Enum
        No [0]
        Yes [1]
    Sensitivity Level
      Range 1 to 10 Unit level
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Sensitivity [SSEN]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 10 Unit level
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Motion [RMOT]

USER QUERY:
Can you increase the motion detector sensitivity to level 8?

The device has a Sensitivity Level property ranging from 1 to 10. The accepted command Set Sensitivity (SSEN) takes a parameter in this range.

To increase sensitivity to level 8, I will send the Set Sensitivity command with parameter 8.

Result: Execute Set Sensitivity (SSEN) with value 8 to increase the hallway motion detector's sensitivity.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Outdoor Smart Sprinkler
  ***Properties***
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit liters_per_minute
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
    Duration
      Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Watering [START]
    Stop Watering [STOP]
    Set Duration [SDUR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 120 Unit minutes
    Enable Schedule [ENSC]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            False [0]
            True [1]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Flow Rate [RFLW]
    Report Schedule Status [RSSC]

USER QUERY:
Please enable the sprinkler schedule and set watering duration to 45 minutes.

The device properties include Schedule Enabled (True/False) and Duration (0-120 minutes). The accepted commands include Enable Schedule (ENSC) with boolean parameter and Set Duration (SDUR) with minutes parameter.

To enable the schedule, I will send Enable Schedule with True. To set watering duration to 45 minutes, I will send Set Duration with 45.

Result: Send Enable Schedule (ENSC) with True and Set Duration (SDUR) with 45 to configure the outdoor sprinkler as requested.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Internal Temperature
      Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Saving Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STMP]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 1 to 10 Unit °C
    Enable Power Saving [EPS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            On [1]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Temperature [RTP]
    Report Door Status [RDS]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on power saving mode and set the fridge temperature to 4 degrees Celsius?

The refrigerator properties include Internal Temperature (1-10 °C) and Power Saving Mode (On/Off). The accepted commands include Enable Power Saving (EPS) with On/Off parameter and Set Temperature (STMP) with temperature parameter.

To turn on power saving mode, I will send Enable Power Saving with parameter On. To set temperature to 4 °C, I will send Set Temperature with parameter 4.

Result: Execute Enable Power Saving (EPS) with On and Set Temperature (STMP) with 4 to configure the smart refrigerator accordingly.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Range 20 to 80 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Range 30 to 70 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Target Temperature [STT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 30 to 70 Unit °C
    Turn On [TON]
    Turn Off [TOF]
    Query [QUERY]
  ***Send Commands***
    Report Current Temperature [RCT]
    Report Power Status [RPS]

USER QUERY:
Please turn on the water heater and set the target temperature to 55 degrees Celsius.

The device properties include Current Temperature (20-80 °C), Target Temperature (30-70 °C), and Power Status (On/Off). The accepted commands include Turn On (TON), Turn Off (TOF), and Set Target Temperature (STT) with a parameter in the target range.

To fulfill the request, I will first send Turn On to power the heater, then Set Target Temperature with 55 °C.

Result: Send Turn On (TON) command followed by Set Target Temperature (STT) with value 55 to activate the water heater and set the desired temperature.
